section: Effective one week from the 1 Launch Date, eDiets shall include a back button to the Women.com Site on all pages of the Diet Center beneath the Gateway Page. If at any time during the Term of this Agreement, eDiets reasonably believes that the inclusion of such back buttons has a material negative effect upon the rate at which users of the Diet Center register to become members of eDiets or convert into registered participants of the services offered by eDiets on the Diet Center (the "Negative Effect"), eDiets may conduct a one (1) month test of the effect of such back buttons which may include the exclusion of the back button. If such test verifies the Negative Effect of the back button(s) to the Women.com Site, eDiets may remove any such back buttons.
explanation: This section allows eDiets to remove back buttons if they negatively affect registration rates, but it's ambiguous how a 'material negative effect' is defined and measured. This lack of clarity could lead to disputes.

section: Women.com agrees that if eDiets elects to extend the Agreement the monthly fee due and payable during the Make Good Period will be recalculated and reduced to reflect the changes in the revised delivery schedule.
explanation: While this sentence states the monthly fee will be recalculated and reduced, it doesn't provide a specific method for how the reduction will be calculated. This ambiguity could lead to disagreements about the correct fee amount during the 'Make Good Period.'

section: eDiets shall determine in its sole discretion the placement, frequency and timing of such Mention, provided that eDiets submits each Mention to Women.com for approval and secures such approval prior to publication or distribution of such Mention.
explanation: eDiets has sole discretion over placement, frequency and timing but Women.com has the right to approve. This could lead to conflict if Women.com consistently disapproves eDiets' decisions, effectively negating eDiets' 'sole discretion.'
